materials.CompanyAbout: Located minutes from Seagrove, North Carolina, Starworks established a clay-processing facility in 2009 to manufacture wild clay for local artists. Starworks Ceramics is currently the only ceramic supply company in US using local wild clays and utilizing a filter press process to create our own custom clay bodies.
materials.Description: East Fork Red is a smooth, stoneware clay body that was developed in conjunction with East Fork Pottery, specifically to fire in a cone 10 gas reduction kiln. It is made with the wonderful wild clays found in North Carolina and fires to a beautiful orange/red color in moderate reduction.
materials.Title: East Fork Red Clay Powder
materials.Materials: 99% North Carolina clays/feldspars
materials.Uses: East Fork Red is great for wheel throwing, hand building and slab work.

materials.CompanyAbout: Located minutes from Seagrove, North Carolina, Starworks established a clay-processing facility in 2009 to manufacture wild clay for local artists. Starworks Ceramics is currently the only ceramic supply company in US using local wild clays and utilizing a filter press process to create our own custom clay bodies.
materials.Description: New Catawba 10 is 99% North Carolina clays/feldspars. This high temperature stoneware clay body is made primarily with wild clay that comes from the Catawba Valley of North Carolina.
materials.Title: New Catawba Clay Powder
materials.Materials: 99% North Carolina clays/feldspars
materials.Uses: New Catawba 10 has very unique properties that make it wonderful to work with on the potter’s wheel, and it is also great for hand building and slab work. It is very well suited for glazed pottery, as seen in many historical Catawba Valley pots, as well as in gas, wood or salt kilns.

materials.CompanyAbout: Located minutes from Seagrove, North Carolina, Starworks established a clay-processing facility in 2009 to manufacture wild clay for local artists. Starworks Ceramics is currently the only ceramic supply company in US using local wild clays and utilizing a filter press process to create our own custom clay bodies.
materials.Description: Okeewemee 10 is a great all-around stoneware clay body is a Native American name which means “land between two rivers”. The name refers to the place of origin for the red NC clay used in this clay body.
materials.Title: Okeewemee 10 Clay Powder
materials.Materials: 100% Wild dug red North Carolina clay
materials.Uses: Okeewemee 10 is used for wheel throwing, handwork and slab work.

materials.CompanyAbout: Located minutes from Seagrove, North Carolina, Starworks established a clay-processing facility in 2009 to manufacture wild clay for local artists. Starworks Ceramics is currently the only ceramic supply company in US using local wild clays and utilizing a filter press process to create our own custom clay bodies.
materials.Description: Dark Star 10 is the darkest clay body made at Starworks Ceramics and is made with wonderful clays and materials found in North Carolina.
materials.Title: Dark STAR 10 Clay Powder
materials.Materials: Dark Star 10 clay body is processed through a 16 mesh screen to preserve more of the rocks and sand found in the wild natural clay.
materials.Uses: Dark Star 10 is used for wheel, handwork and slabwork, firing out to a rich dark brown/red in a reduction atmosphere. It is fairly refractory and can withstand a hot and long firing.

materials.Description: Wild Porcelin is a fine, usually white clay formed by the weathering of aluminous minerals.
materials.Title: Wild Porcelin Powder
materials.Materials: A mixture of clay, kaolin, silica, quartz, feldspar, and other materials. Kaolin is the key component in porcelain, giving it its tight
materials.Uses: Wild Porcelin clay is used for wheel, throwing, hand building and slab work.

materials.CompanyAbout:
Glass Batch for the Studio Artist
For over thirty years Spruce Pine Batch has set the standard providing premium glass batch for artists worldwide. Developed by glass artists for glass artists, our batch is formulated for superior workability and excellent clarity. Our rigorous quality control allows us to deliver a product that is consistent and predictable. Glass artists agree, we deliver a durable glass that fits the wide range of colors available. Our batch is considered to be the best available for everyone from individuals to mass production studios.
materials.Description: Soda Lime Glass designed and formulated for the specific needs of the glass industry. Developed by glass artists for glass artists.
materials.Title: Silica Sand Mix / Soda Lime Glass
materials.Uses: Pemium glass batch for artists worldwide. Formulated for superior workability and excellent clarity.

materials.CompanyAbout: Mary W. Thompson is an esteemed second-generation basket weaver, veteran, entrepreneur, and enrolled member of the Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians (EBCI).
materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Description: Rivercane is a large grass in the bamboo species native to the southeastern United States, including North Carolina. It is highly valued for its durability, lightweight nature, and strength, which makes it extremely versatile for various uses.
materials.Title: Rivercane
materials.Uses: For centuries, the Eastern Band of Cherokee and their ancestors have utilized native rivercane for a variety of purposes such as weaponry, basketry, pottery and chair making, house construction, food, medicines, and more.

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Description: Unfinished Rivercane Splits show the process of splitting rivercane a large grass in the bamboo species native to North Carolina, primarily found in the western Mountain region. Splits are the result of splitting rivercane into strips, often done for weaving baskets and mats.
materials.Title: Rivercane Unfinished Splits
materials.Uses: Rivercane Unfished Splits show the process of splitting rivercane into strips, often done for weaving rivercane baskets and matts.

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Description: Rivercane Splits are split from rivercane, a large grass in the bamboo species native to North Carolina, primarily found in the western Mountain region. Splits are the result of splitting rivercane into strips, often done for weaving baskets and mats
materials.Title: Rivercane Splits
materials.Uses: Rivercane Splits are often used for weaving rivercane baskets and matts.

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Description: Butternut Dyed Rivercane Splits come from rivercane that has been split into strips and dyed with extracted color from the inner bark of a butternut tree.
materials.Title: Butternut Dyed Rivercane Splits
materials.Uses: Butternut Dyed Rivercane Splits are often used for weaving rivercane baskets and matts.

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Description: Butternut Bark comes from the Butternut tree, native to North Carolina, primarily found in the western Mountain region. The Butternut bark is light gray and shallowly furrowed.
materials.Title: Butternut Bark
materials.Uses: Butternut Bark is often used to create dyes for basket weaving and textiles, resulting in brown, red-brown, or orange-red colored objects.

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Description: Butternut Limb comes from the Butternut tree, native to North Carolina, primarily found in the western Mountain region. The Butternut bark is light gray and shallowly furrowed.
materials.Title: Butternut Limb
materials.Uses: Butternut is often used in woodworking, in particular to carve objects.

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Description: Undyed White Oak Splits come from the white oak tree, which is native to the eastern United States and is commonly found in western North Carolina. Splits are the result of splitting white oak limbs into strips, often done for weaving baskets and mats.
materials.Title: Undyed White Oak Splits
materials.Uses: Undyed White Oak Splits are often used for  for weaving baskets and mats.

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Description: Bloodroot Dyed White Oak Splits are created by splitting white oak limbs into strips and then dyeing them with bloodroot. This process is often used for weaving baskets and mats.
materials.Title: Bloodroot Dyed White Oak Splits

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Description: Walnut Dyed White Oak Splits are created by splitting white oak tree limbs into strips and then dyeing them with blackwalnut. This process is often used for weaving baskets and mats.
materials.Title: Walnut Dyed White Oak Splits

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Description: Unfinished White Oak Splits show the process of splitting  white oak tree limbs into strips. Splits are the result of splitting rivercane into strips, often done for weaving baskets and mats.
materials.Title: Unifinished White Oak Split

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Title: White Oak Drop Handle

materials.CompanyName: Mary W. Thompson, Cherokee Baskets & Vessels
materials.Title: White Oak Lock Handle

materials.Description: RTXFIB-NCIB Fiber Fill is Material Return's North Carolina Industry Blend sourced from 100% reclamied fibers from western Nother Carolina
materials.Title: RTXFIB-NCIB  Fiber Fill (Grey)
materials.Materials: 100% Reclaimed ReturnTex™ Fibers Sourced from Western, North Carolina, USA
materials.Uses: RTXFIB-NCIB Fiber Fill is typically used for insulation, fillers, and fabrics made from fibers that are cut or gathered together and bonded using chemical adhesion, mechanical or heat treatment, or a combination of these methods.

materials.Description: RTXFIB-NCIB Fiber Fill is Material Return's North Carolina Industry Blend sourced from 100% reclamied fibers from western Nother Carolina
materials.Title: RTXFIB-NCIB  Fiber Fill (Red)
materials.Materials: 100% Reclaimed ReturnTex™ Fibers Sourced from Western, North Carolina, USA
materials.Uses: RTXFIB-NCIB Fiber Fill is typically used for insulation, fillers, and fabrics made from fibers that are cut or gathered together and bonded using chemical adhesion, mechanical or heat treatment, or a combination of these methods.

materials.CompanyAbout: Karl Grimm GmbH & Co. KG is a German based manufacturing and distribution company specializing in Leonian goods, gold and silver yarns for the manufacture of cords, braids, braids and galloons.
materials.Description: Conductive thread is a special type of fiber material that carries electricity. It retains the thin and flexible qualities of regular thread, allowing it to form various shapes and connect to different conductive materials and components. This makes conductive thread especially valuable for creating sewn circuits, also known as soft circuits or e-textiles, where electronics are integrated with textiles.
materials.Title: High-Flex 4355 Kupfer Blank, Copper Thread
materials.Materials: Polyester, Copper
materials.Uses: Conductive threads are typically produced for applications such as anti-static properties, electromagnetic shielding, smart textiles, wearable technology, data transmission, and heating functions. These threads are designed with fine, flattened wires coiled around them to make them conductive.

materials.CompanyAbout: Karl Grimm GmbH & Co. KG is a German based manufacturing and distribution company specializing in Leonian goods, gold and silver yarns for the manufacture of cords, braids, braids and galloons.
materials.Description: Conductive thread is a special type of fiber material that carries electricity. It retains the thin and flexible qualities of regular thread, allowing it to form various shapes and connect to different conductive materials and components. This makes conductive thread especially valuable for creating sewn circuits, also known as soft circuits or e-textiles, where electronics are integrated with textiles.
materials.Title: High-Flex 3981 Sliber, Silver Thread
materials.Materials: Polyester, Silver
materials.Uses: Conductive threads are typically produced for applications such as anti-static properties, electromagnetic shielding, smart textiles, wearable technology, data transmission, and heating functions. These threads are designed with fine, flattened wires coiled around them to make them conductive.

materials.CompanyAbout: The cast polyurethane sample chip shows the versatility of the material, allowing for casting with different textures, forms, and level of detail. The cast polyurethane can reach up to 72% biobased content. Common uses include winter and water sport hard goods, climbing holds, automotive and other RIM components, and electrical encapsulation. All of Checkerspot's commercial Cast PU is USDA Certified Biobased, meaning they have been verified as meeting or exceeding the required biobased content for their product category.
materials.Description: Checkerspot® Cast Polyurethane (PU) is designed with both performance and sustainability in mind. Made from renewable algae oil, they enable artists, designers, and manufacturers to replace petroleum-based incumbent materials with a high-quality, biobased alternative.
materials.Title: Checkerspot® Cast PU
materials.Uses: Checkerspot® Cast PU is used for winter and water sport hard goods, climbing holds, automotive and other RIM components, electrical encapsulation.

materials.CompanyAbout: Checkerspot's algae-based polyurethane foams can reach up to 42% biobased, and are suitable for both molding and free rise production, conforming to a variety of shapes. The coaster shows how easy the rigid polyurethane foam boards are to cut and carve. Common uses include core material for outdoor recreation hard goods (alpine and backcountry skis  and snowboards, water skis, paddles, hydrofoils) and core material for composites in automotive and construction industries. All of Checkerspot's commercial Rigid PU Foam is USDA Certified Biobased, meaning they have been verified as meeting or exceeding the required biobased content for their product category.
materials.Description: Checkerspot® Rigid Polyurethane (PU) Foam is designed with both performance and sustainability in mind. Made from renewable algae oil, they enable artists, designers, and manufacturers to replace petroleum-based incumbent materials with a high-quality, biobased alternative.
materials.Title: Checkerspot® Rigid PU Foam
materials.Uses: Checkerspot® Rigid Polyurethane (PU) Foam is used for outdoor recreation hard goods (alpine and backcountry skis  and snowboards, water skis, paddles, hydrofoils) and core material for composites in automotive, construction industries.

materials.CompanyAbout:
PLA is often marketed as compostable, but it is only compostable under specific conditions. It will not biodegrade without the help of industrially prouced composting equipment and heat.

This Flexi-Rexi design is an open-source design by Dr. Lex shared under the Creative Commons - Attribution - Share Alike license. It is a remix of Kirbs' Flexi Rex (Thingiverse thing:1759297), based on airfish's remix (Thingiverse thing:2189652). That model in turn was most likely inspired by the ‘Flexy Rex’ by zheng3 (Thingiverse thing:929413).
materials.Description: PLA (Polylactic Acid) Filament is a thermoplastic monomer that is derived through the fermentation of renewable, plant-based materials such as corn starch and sugar cane. It is frequently used in both molded thermoformed products as well as additive manufacturing like 3D printing. It is only compostable in an industrial facitility and does not biodegrade on its own.
materials.Title: PLA Filament
materials.Uses: PLA (Polylactic Acid) Filament  is used for films and coatings for food packaging, plastic cold cups, 3D printer filament, biomedical implants, water repellent upholstry and textiles.

materials.Description: Cast Acrylic Sheet is a clear, petroleum derived thermoplastic that is both impact and shatter resistant. Also called plexiglass (which is a brand of acrylic sheet), it is known for it's superior optical clarity and surface finish.  It can be easily cut with a bandsaw or lasercutter.
materials.Title: Cast Acrylic Sheet
materials.Uses: Cast Acrylic Sheet is used for windows, displays, enclosures, shelving, signage, sneezeguards, lighting, and furniture.

materials.Description: Hot Glue is a thermoplastic adhesive.
materials.Title: Hot Glue
materials.Uses: Hot glue is commonly used in bookbinding and is suitable for binding materials such as wood, plastic, and metal.

materials.CompanyAbout: Keel labs is a next-gen materials company creating textile solutions inspired by the ocean. It is platform for innovation, broadening our vision for the potential of the ocean to accelerate our planet’s development towards a more sustainable future.
materials.Description: Jersey Knit Textile Swatch is made with 50% kelsun fiber and 50% cotton, mounted on seaweed paper. Kelsun, is a bio-based fiber made with an abundant biopolymer found in seaweed.
materials.Title: Jersey Knit Textile  Swatch
materials.Uses: Kelsun fits directly into existing globalized textile infrastructure, and has applications in fashion, furniture, and beyond. Kelsun has the ability to be blended with other fibers, and is shown in a cotton blend, woven and knit into textile swatches.

materials.CompanyAbout: Keel labs is a next-gen materials company creating textile solutions inspired by the ocean. It is platform for innovation, broadening our vision for the potential of the ocean to accelerate our planet’s development towards a more sustainable future.
materials.Description: Basket Weave Textile Swatch made with 25% kelsun fiber and 75% cotton, mounted on seaweed paper. Kelsun, is a bio-based fiber made with an abundant biopolymer found in seaweed.
materials.Title: Basket Weave Textile Swatch
materials.Uses: Kelsun fits directly into existing globalized textile infrastructure, and has applications in fashion, furniture, and beyond. Kelsun has the ability to be blended with other fibers, and is shown in a cotton blend, woven and knit into textile swatches.

materials.CompanyAbout: Cultivated in the Philippine highlands within a natural ecosystem of sustainable mixed agriculture and forestry, the plant is self-sufficient, requires no pesticides, fertilizer or extra water. These qualities have allowed it to contribute to reforestation in areas once eroded due to monocultural palm plantations, whilst enhancing biodiversity and the economic prosperity of its farmers.
materials.Description: Bananatex® is the world’s first durable, technical fabric made purely from the naturally grown Abacá banana plants.
materials.Title: Bananatex® Fiber
materials.Uses: Bananatex®  fiber is used for textile and garment production, and upholstery.

materials.CompanyAbout: Sway x Ecoenclose is a collaboration between a home compostable seaweed materials company and a sustainable packaging company to create truly recyclable consumer packaging.
materials.Description: Seaweed-Based Consumer Packaging is made out of an alginate bioplastic film display window from Sway and recycled paperboard packaging from Ecoenclose. Marine biodegradable bioplastic can be dissolved during the recycling phase instead of being diverted to landfill, as traditional petroleum and agriculturally-derived plastics are.
materials.Title: Seaweed-Based Consumer Packaging
materials.Materials: Seaweed derived bioplastic film and recycled paper board.
materials.Uses: Seaweed-based consumer packaging is used for a variety of applications, including packaging for consumer goods and compostable bags.

materials.Description: Flax is a type of bast fiber,  extracted from the inner bark of the flax plant's stem. This flax sample was grown and harvested at Warren Wilson College located in Swananoa, North Carolina. It displays an over-retted treatment, resulting in coarser and darker-colored fibers.
materials.Title: Flax Fiber
materials.Uses: Flax fiber is used to produce linen, often used to make garments, bedding, lace, twine, and rope.

materials.Description: Coopworth Wool from a Teeswater x Gotland Sheep, raised on the Warren Wilson College campus, located in Swananoa, North Carolina.
materials.Title: Coopworth Wool (Teeswater x Gotland Sheep)
materials.Uses: Wool is often used for textile and grament production.

materials.Description: Bamboo viscose, a semi-synthetic fabric derived from the bamboo plant, shares similarities with silk due to its qualities.
materials.Title: Bamboo Viscose
materials.Uses: Bamboo Viscose is often used for garment and household textiles production  like sheets, blankets, towels, hand towels, and more.

materials.Description: Bombyx Silk is farm-raised and cultivated from the mulberry silk moth. When farmed, the fiber is not broken when the moth exits from the cocoon.
materials.Title: Bombyx Silk
materials.Uses: Bombyx silk is a durable, shiny, and breathable fabric that can be woven, braided, or twisted into rope. It is often used for felting, hand spinning, and making silk paper.

materials.Description: Tussah Silk is wild caught, cultivated from tussah silk moth. When wild caught the fiber is broken when the moth eats it's way of the cacoon.
materials.Title: Tussah Silk
materials.Uses: Tussah silk is easy to spin, which results in yarns that are very soft and great for comfort and performance. Garments made from tussah silk have the main functions of regulating body temperature, wicking moisture, and ensuring a good fit.

materials.Description: Red Leaf Cotton grown and harvested on the Warren Wilson College located in Swannanoa, North Carolina
materials.Title: Red Leaf Cotton
materials.Uses: Red Leaf Cotton is often used for fabric, cloth and other garment and household textile production.

materials.Description: Cotton cultivated by Hagood Mill Historic site of water powerd griss mill built in 1845, South Carolina
materials.Title: Cotton
materials.Uses: Cotton is often used for fabric, cloth and other garment and household textile production.

materials.Description: Nettle Fiber extratced from the stinging nettle plant. Fibers have a fine shine. The fiber is absorbent and antibacterial.
materials.Title: Nettle Fiber
materials.Uses: Nettle is often used to make sailcloth, rope, clothing, and other textile products.

materials.Description: Kudzu raised and harvested in  Swannanoa, North Carolina.
materials.Title: Kudzu
materials.Uses: Kudzu is commonly used for making clothing, textiles, paper pulp, baskets, and crafts such as spinning and crocheting, alongside silk and ramie.

materials.CompanyAbout: The Patchwork Underground​ is a place to get your hands dirty and your creativity flowing in the midst of beautiful gardens and open spaces. Join Alyssa Sacora for workshops in natural dyeing, paper making, bookbinding & basketry. Or take home a treasure made with plants. Located in Fairview, NC just outside of Asheville
materials.Description: Tulip poplar (Liriodendron tulipifera) saplings were harvested from western North Carolina in June 2023. The saplings were submerged in water to ferment. The outer bark was cleaned off, and the inner bark was removed from the wood. After fermentation, the tulip poplar was rinsed and dried.
materials.Title: Tulip Poplar
materials.Uses: Tulip Poplar is often used to make pulp for papermaking.

materials.CompanyAbout: The Patchwork Underground​ is a place to get your hands dirty and your creativity flowing in the midst of beautiful gardens and open spaces. Join Alyssa Sacora for workshops in natural dyeing, paper making, bookbinding & basketry. Or take home a treasure made with plants. Located in Fairview, NC just outside of Asheville
materials.Description: Kudzu summer runner vines were harvested in Western North Carolina. The leaves were stripped, and the vines were submerged in water to ferment. Afterward, the outer layer was rinsed off, and the bast and core material were dried.
materials.Title: Kudzu Vine
materials.Uses: Kudzu Vine is often used to make pulp for papermaking.

materials.CompanyAbout: The Patchwork Underground​ is a place to get your hands dirty and your creativity flowing in the midst of beautiful gardens and open spaces. Join Alyssa Sacora for workshops in natural dyeing, paper making, bookbinding & basketry. Or take home a treasure made with plants. Located in Fairview, NC just outside of Asheville
materials.Description: Okra is a bast fiber. It's stems were harvested in western North Carolina after a frost at the end of the growing season. The okra was submerged in water to ferment. The outer layer of the stems was rinsed off, and the bast fibers were removed from the woody core. The fibers were then rinsed and dried.
materials.Title: Okra
materials.Uses: Okra is often used to make pulp for papermaking.

materials.CompanyAbout: The Patchwork Underground​ is a place to get your hands dirty and your creativity flowing in the midst of beautiful gardens and open spaces. Join Alyssa Sacora for workshops in natural dyeing, paper making, bookbinding & basketry. Or take home a treasure made with plants. Located in Fairview, NC just outside of Asheville
materials.Description: Siberian iris (Iris siberica) has grass-like foliage with upright, yellow-green, narrow, fairly rigid, blade-shaped leaves. The leaves were harvested in western North Carolina during late summer/early fall and then dried.
materials.Title: Siberian iris Leaves
materials.Uses: Siberian iris (Iris siberica) Leaves are often used to make pulp for papermaking.

materials.CompanyAbout: The Patchwork Underground​ is a place to get your hands dirty and your creativity flowing in the midst of beautiful gardens and open spaces. Join Alyssa Sacora for workshops in natural dyeing, paper making, bookbinding & basketry. Or take home a treasure made with plants. Located in Fairview, NC just outside of Asheville
materials.Description: Fiber banana (Musa Basjoo) pseudo-stems harvested in western North Carolina after a frost, cut, and dried.
materials.Title: Fiber Banana (Musa Basjoo) Pseudo-Stems
materials.Uses: Fiber banana (Musa Basjoo) Pseudo-Stems is often used to make pulp for papermaking.

materials.Description: Abaca is processed from the Musa textilis plant. The fiber is extracted from the leaf sheath that surrounds the plant's trunk.
materials.Title: Abaca
materials.Uses: Abaca is often used to make pulp for papermaking.

materials.Description: Cotton Linter is processed from the Gossypium plant. Linter is the short cellulose fibers left on the seed after the staple cotton is removed by ginning.
materials.Title: Cotton Linter
materials.Uses: Cotton Linter is often used to make pulp for papermaking. It is also used to make coarse yarns and many cellulose products.

materials.Description: Copper is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity. Copper has a red, pinkish-orange color.
materials.Title: Copper Pipe
materials.Uses: Copper is often used in jewelry making and other metalsmithing practices.

materials.Description: Steel is an alloy of carbon and iron. Due to it's strenght and low cost, steel is one of the most commonly manufactured materials in the world.
materials.Title: Steel (Square Nail)
materials.Uses: Steel is often used in metalsmithing and blacksmithing.

materials.Description: Glass Mirror is a highly polished piece of glass with a silver backing, applied either through liquid or sticker form.
materials.Title: Glass Mirror
materials.Uses: Glass Mirror can be cut like glass and is often used  to apply reflective and mosaic surfaces.

materials.CompanyAbout: Torched aims to bolster community and inclusivity while promoting craft as a career. People who are motivated will have the opportunity to learn a trade they can use to support themselves. Building community is a huge part of this
materials.Description: Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc, in proportions which can be varied to achieve different colours and mechanical, electrical, acoustic and chemical properties
materials.Title: Brass
materials.Uses: Brass is often used in metalsmithing and blacksmithing.

materials.CompanyAbout: Torched aims to bolster community and inclusivity while promoting craft as a career. People who are motivated will have the opportunity to learn a trade they can use to support themselves. Building community is a huge part of this
materials.Description: Copper is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity. Copper has a red, pinkish-orange color.
materials.Title: Copper
materials.Uses: Copper is often used in jewelry making and other metalsmithing practices

materials.CompanyAbout: Torched aims to bolster community and inclusivity while promoting craft as a career. People who are motivated will have the opportunity to learn a trade they can use to support themselves. Building community is a huge part of this
materials.Description: Powdered glass enamel, also known as porcelain enamel, is a material created by fusing powdered glass to a substrate through firing. The powder melts, flows, and then solidifies into a smooth, durable vitreous coating.
materials.Title: Powdered Glass Enamel - Rose Pink
materials.Materials: Enamel powder is created by smelting a mixture of raw materials like silica sand, feldspar, borax, soda ash, and sodium fluoride in a furnace, followed by grinding into a powder.
materials.Uses: Powdered glass enamel is commonly used in metalsmithing, sculpture, and ceramics to apply a colored glossy coating and design to objects. It is also utilized in industrial production for appliances, cookware, signage, and bathtubs.

materials.CompanyAbout: Adafruit, established in 2005, is dedicated to providing a premier online platform for learning electronics and offering high-quality products for makers of all ages and skill levels. The company offers a wide range of tools, equipment, and electronics, each carefully selected, tested, and approved before being added to the store. Adafruit is proud to be a 100% woman-owned manufacturing company
materials.Description: Side-emitting fiber optics, or side glow fibers, emit light along their length, creating a uniform glow. Their construction allows light to gradually escape, similar to neon tubes. The intensity is highest near the source and can be enhanced with powerful LEDs or lasers, or by placing light sources at both ends.
materials.Title: Side Glow Fiber Optics
materials.Materials: high-purity glass (silica), plastic
materials.Uses: Side-emitting fiber optics are commonly used in illumination applications for decorative lighting and signage, as well as in medical settings for precise and flexible illumination during minimally invasive procedures.

materials.CompanyAbout: Kathryn Walters is a PhD student and researcher in textile design, specialising in weaving. Walter's research explores the development of transformative textiles, woven flat and which self-assemble to take three-dimensional form.
materials.Description: Handwoven "Animated Linen" was created by is a hygromorphic textile, meaning it changes shape when exposed to moisture, due to the high twist in the linen weft. The sample can be activated by spraying with water or when placed in a vaery humid enviorment. As it drys they will relax and can activated repeadley.
materials.Title: Handwoven "Animated Linen"
materials.Materials: Warp: Bleached cotton, Nm 50/2 at 32 ends per cm. Weft: pale yellow high-twist linen, Nm 21/3, zzz/Z at 25 degree twist angle, approxiamlety 7 picks per cm

materials.Description: Conductive Core-spun Yarn has a conductive thread core, insulated with a merino wool spun casing
materials.Title: Conductive Core-spun Yarn
materials.Materials: Statex silver-coated nylon and merino wool
materials.Uses: Conductive Core-spun Yarn is incorporated in electronic textiles and soft cirucuits, use in knitting, crochet, and weaving.

materials.Description: Extruded Biofaom is a biodegrable foam that is extruded from a syringe into long lines of filament, which can be used in fiber craft.
materials.Title: Extruded Biofoam
materials.Materials: Biodegradable biofoam (soap, gelatine, water, glycerine)
materials.Uses: Extruded Biofaom is used for crochet, knitting, integrated into cltohing for temporary alterations

materials.Description: Molded Biofoam is a biodegradable foam extruded, then cooled in a pertri dish, causing the sample to hold the shape of the container.
materials.Title: Molded Biofoam
materials.Materials: Biodegradable biofoam (soap, gelatine, water, glycerine)
materials.Uses: Molded Biofoam is a single-use foam pieces (packaging,) acts as cloth planels that can be sewn together.

materials.Description: White Supercoil Conductive Yarn With Exposed Leads has a conductive thread core, insulated with white merino wool spun in a supercoil technique around core. Areas of exposed conductive thread create leads or electronic connection points.
materials.Title: White Supercoil Conductive Yarn With Exposed Leads
materials.Materials: Statex silver-coated nylon thread and and merino wool
materials.Uses: White Supercoil Conductive Yarn With Exposed Leads are incorporated in electronic textiles and soft cirucuits, use in knitting, crochet, and weaving.

materials.Description: Red Supercoil Conductive Yarn With Exposed Leads has a conductive thread core, insulated with white merino wool spun in a supercoil technique around core. Areas of exposed conductive thread create leads or electronic connection points.
materials.Title: Red Supercoil Conductive Yarn With Exposed Leads
materials.Materials: Statex silver-coated nylon thread and and merino wool
materials.Uses: Red Supercoil Conductive Yarn With Exposed Leads are incorporated n electronic textiles and soft cirucuits, use in knitting, crochet, and weaving

materials.Description: Supercoil Silicone Wire Yarn is a long, white wool single is tightly coiled around the black silicone-coated wire, leaving a little of the black wire visible underneath.
materials.Title: Supercoil Silicone Wire Yarn
materials.Materials: Silicone-encased wire and merino wool
materials.Uses: Supercoil Silicone Wire Yarn is incorporated in electronic textiles and soft cirucuits, use in knitting, crochet, and weaving

materials.Description: Gelatin Biofibers is an untreated gelatin-based fibers extruded using our Open-Source Biofibers Spinning Machine
materials.Title: Gelatin Biofibers
materials.Materials: Biodegradable gelatin fibers (animal-based gelatin, water, and isopropanol)
materials.Uses: Incorporated on the weft of single-use woven sensons (pressure or moisture) to enable dissasembly of conductive and non-conduve materiales in the sensors at the end-of-life

materials.CompanyAbout: Widely considered to be the premier wood substitute with the smallest ecological footprint of any lumber alternative, HempWood® is perfect for use as anything that wood can be used for, like construction materials, flooring, and furniture. Mass production and order fulfillment began in the third quarter of 2019.  HempWood® uses a variety of eco-friendly hemp materials to create sustainable building supplies.  Most of our products are non-toxic hemp composite woods that can be used for a wide variety of interior design and general construction.
materials.Description: HempWood®  Rift sawn Lumber Sample is a sustainable material suitable replacement for traditional solid hardwoods, such as white oak, in most interior non-structural products and processes.
materials.Title: Rift Sawn Lumber Sample
materials.Materials: Made from hemp that is grown within 100 miles of the HempWood® factory in Murray, Kentucky.
materials.Uses: HempWood® product applications include- benches, shelves, cutting boards, trim, window frames, dressers, tables, and more.

materials.CompanyAbout: Widely considered to be the premier wood substitute with the smallest ecological footprint of any lumber alternative, HempWood® is perfect for use as anything that wood can be used for, like construction materials, flooring, and furniture. materials.Title: HempWood® Oragnic Flooring Natural - Hemp
materials.Materials: Made from hemp that is grown within 100 miles of the HempWood® factory in Murray, Kentucky.

materials.Description: Taupe HempWood® flooring brings new dimensions of design with rustic characteristics. In addition, this sustainable material is easy to customize and install.
materials.Title: HempWood® Organic Flooring - Taupe
materials.Materials: Taupe HempWood® is pressed with soy-based adhesives, made from hemp that is grown within 100 miles of the HempWood® factory in Murray, Kentucky.
materials.Uses: Taupe HempWood® flooring provides ease of application for contractor use and allows for customization on site.

materials.CompanyAbout: Widely considered to be the premier wood substitute with the smallest ecological footprint of any lumber alternative, HempWood® is perfect for use as anything that wood can be used for, like construction materials, flooring, and furniture. materials.Description: 3-layer Rift Faces Panel sample is an engineered HempWood veneers laminated onto PureBond Plywood.
materials.Title: 3-layer rift faces panel sample
materials.Materials: The 3-layer panels are constructed from crosslaminated solid HempWood®.
materials.Uses: HempWood® panels are perfect for cabinetry, shelving, and furniture.

materials.CompanyAbout:
Hemptecture: 
We produce healthier, more sustainable alternatives to conventional, toxic thermal insulation. Hempitecture manufactures building materials that significantly reduce embodied carbon in the built environment by using rapidly renewable plant-based feedstocks that are carbon capturing, and restore rural agriculture at scale.
materials.Description: Hempwool is made from Hemp fiber batt insulation for wood and metal framing systems. Friction-fit design ensures the insulation will not slump or sag in the cavity. VOC free, nontoxic, & treated with natural fire retardant.
materials.Title: Hempwool
materials.Materials: Biobased insulation manufactured from industrial hemp and natural fibers.
materials.Uses: Hemp is a carbon-capturing, soil-regenerating crop that requires no pesticides, no fertilizers, little water to farm and restores rural agriculture at scale. Hempwool can be used for exterior and interior cavity thermo-acoustic insulation.

materials.CompanyAbout:
Hemptecture: 
We produce healthier, more sustainable alternatives to conventional, toxic thermal insulation. Hempitecture manufactures building materials that significantly reduce embodied carbon in the built environment by using rapidly renewable plant-based feedstocks that are carbon capturing, and restore rural agriculture at scale.
materials.Title: Plantpanel
materials.Uses: Hemp is a carbon-capturing, soil-regenerating crop that requires no pesticides, no fertilizers, little water to farm and restores rural agriculture at scale.

materials.Description: Fiberpad is a natural fiber based, non-toxic carpet underlayment with a luxurious feel that doesn’t compromise health or sustainability.
materials.Title: Fiberpad
materials.Uses: Hemp is a carbon-capturing, soil-regenerating crop that requires no pesticides, no fertilizers, little water to farm and restores rural agriculture at scale. The Fiberpad can be applied over a subfloor or substrate before the installation of carpet.

materials.Description: Standard Screen ALGAE INK is a water-based screen printing ink for use on textiles/apparel with soft hand feel and antique black color.
materials.Title: Standard Screen ALAGE INK
materials.Materials: Bio-based and renewable ink made from algae-deroved pigment.
materials.Uses: Standard Screen ALGAE INK is used in many applications such as offset, screen, and flexographic printing projects to achieve a high-performance, black color for different products including packaging, apparel and footwear.

materials.CompanyAbout: Unlike stone, plastic and other solid-surface materials, Richlite is an incredibly durable, sustainable and versatile material made from paper. High-grade custom FSC-certified paper infused with a thermosetting resin is laid up by hand and pressed into a solid panel.
materials.Description: Richlite is an incredibly durable, sustainable and versatile material made from paper. Natural has a mottled appearance mixed with a warm amber color, with time darkening to a beautiful sienna hue.
materials.Title: Richlite "Natural" Sample
materials.Materials: 100% recycled products using an exclusive waste-to-energy process, "Natural" is made with neutral-colored paper, the color you see is purely a result of the resin.
materials.Uses: Richlite is a popular choice for interior and exterior architectural surfaces, such as wall paneling, countertops, and cabinetry. It's also ideal for exterior cladding and rainscreens.

materials.CompanyAbout: Tori Motyl is a ceramic artist and teacher based in the mountains of North Carolina.
materials.Description: WNC Wild Dug Fired Clay Slab created by ceramic artist Tori Motyl, using WNC clay with no additives.
materials.Title: Western North Carolina Wild Dug Fired Clay Slab 1
materials.Materials: 100% wild dug western North Caorlina Clay
materials.Uses: Wild clay is often used for pottery and sculpture.

materials.Description: WNC Wild Dug Fired Clay Slab created by ceramic artist Tori Motyl, using WNC clay with no additives.

materials.CompanyAbout: Sam Bourgault is a Ph.D. Candidate in Media Arts and Technology at the University of California Santa Barbara. Bourgault works with Professor Jennifer Jacobs in the Expressive Computation Lab. Bourgault develops action-oriented systems for digital fabrication informed by craft workflows through collaboration with domain experts and artifact production.
materials.Title: Ceramic 3D print

materials.CompanyAbout: North Carolina Glass Center is a non-profit, public access glass studio and gallery. Our low-cost shared studios help emerging artists launch their careers and enable established glass artists to pursue new and ambitious challenges. Our gallery showcases the finest work from undiscovered to established glass artists in Western North Carolina. Our educational programs provide thousands of aspiring glass artists with high quality, affordable instruction. Our community outreach programs provide safe spaces for veterans, youth and marginalized individuals to learn the science and healing power of glass.
materials.Description: Batch is a raw material that cooks into clear glass.
materials.Title: Batch
materials.Materials: soda ash, limestone, and sand
materials.Uses: Batch is used for making glass and in glassblowing.

materials.CompanyAbout: North Carolina Glass Center is a non-profit, public access glass studio and gallery. Our gallery showcases the finest work from undiscovered to established glass artists in Western North Carolina. Our educational programs provide thousands of aspiring glass artists with high quality, affordable instruction. Our community outreach programs provide safe spaces for veterans, youth and marginalized individuals to learn the science and healing power of glass.
materials.Description: Frit is granular crushed glass that comes in many colors and several different mesh sizes used as a means to add color to glass.
materials.Title: Frit
materials.Materials: silica, fluorspar, soda ash, borax, feldspar, zircon, aluminum oxide, lithium carbonate, magnesium carbonate, and titanium oxide
materials.Uses: Frit is often used by furnace working glassblowers and lampworkers use frit regularly as a means of adding color to their work.

materials.Description: Stringers is clear furnace glass that has been stretched into long string.
materials.Title: Stringers
materials.Uses: Glass stringers are thin filaments of glass that can be used to create unique designs and patterns in glass blowing.

materials.Title: Kevlar Threads
materials.Uses: Kevlar thread has incredibly high resistance to moisture, aging, abrasion, weather, and high temperatures

Our gallery showcases the finest work from undiscovered to established glass artists in Western North Carolina. Our educational programs provide thousands of aspiring glass artists with high quality, affordable instruction. Our community outreach programs provide safe spaces for veterans, youth and marginalized individuals to learn the science and healing power of glass.
materials.Description: Millefiori are paterned chips of glass used in decorative glass works
materials.Title: Millefiori
materials.Uses: Millefiori glass is a type of decorative handmade glass that originated in Murano Venice, Italy. The millefiori pattern is created by cutting and fritting

materials.CompanyAbout: Lexington Glassworks, located in the heart of downtown Asheville, NC, was born out of the desire to create timeless and innovative hand-blown glass and custom lighting. Each piece is skillfully crafted using century old techniques and locally sourced material with the singular goal of creating top-notch work.
materials.Description: Frit is granular crushed glass that comes in many colors and several different mesh sizes used as a means to add color to glass.
materials.Title: Frit - Purple
materials.Materials: silica, fluorspar, soda ash, borax, feldspar, zircon, aluminum oxide, lithium carbonate, magnesium carbonate, and titanium oxide
materials.Uses: Frit is often used by furnace working glassblowers and lampworkers use frit regularly as a means of adding color to their work.

materials.Description: Cullet is crushed and recyled glass waste.
materials.Title: Cullet
materials.Materials: Recycled glass
materials.Uses: Cullet can replace materials such as silica, limestone, and soda ash used in glass blowing and is often used to create new glass and fiberglass.

materials.CompanyAbout: Craftwork is a multidisciplinary design and art studio exploring the nature of textiles and technology through installations, storytelling, and material-based research.
materials.Description: Mock Rib Pocket Stretch Sensor is a knitted stretch sensor that can be connected to an output such as a light to decrease or increase the brightness. This sensor was made with conductive and non-conductive yarns using a Brother KH-910 knitting machine.
materials.Title: Mock Rib Pocket Stretch Sensor
materials.Materials: Conductive Yarn, Non-Conductive Yarn
materials.Uses: Mock Rib Pocket Stretch Sensor is used for e-textiles & wearables

materials.CompanyAbout: Empa conducts cutting-edge materials and technology research, generating interdisciplinary solutions to major challenges faced by industry, and creates the necessary scientific basis to ensure that our society develops in a sustainable manner. As part of the ETH Domain, Empa is committed to excellence in all its activities.
materials.Description: Developed by the research team at Empa, this liquid glycerol core fiber optic offers significant improvements in durability and flexibility compared to conventional glass fiber optics. Traditional glass fiber optics are ideal for long-distance data transmission but are prone to damage from strong bending or tensile stress. In contrast, the glycerol core fiber optics can withstand up to ten percent elongation and return to its original length without damage, making it highly resilient.
materials.Title: Liquid Glycerol Core Fiber Optic
materials.Materials: PMMA (plexi-glass), fluorescent dye,  glycerol
materials.Uses: Fiber optic cables are commonly used for transmitting data over long distances.

materials.Description: OM4 Ball Clay is highyl plastic clay, minded near the border of Tennessee and Kentucky. Similar materials have been industrially minded in this region since the late 1800s
